thread.title: Week ahead: Chinese GDP and ECB policy meeting in focus
thread.title_full: Week ahead: Chinese GDP and ECB policy meeting in focus

title: Week ahead: Chinese GDP and ECB policy meeting in focus
text:
227.00 -1.000 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Data on China's third quarter gross domestic due out on Monday may help to set the tone for the rest of the week, although it would be highly surprising if Beijing let the official data stray too far from the market consensus. The median forecast from economists is for growth of 6.7% for the three months to September. 
Also looming large on the agenda is Thursday's European Central bank policy meeting. All eyes will be on whether ECB president Mario Draghi drops any hints regarding a possible stepping of quantitative easing in the euro area. 
On the following day, the ECB will publish the results of its latest survey of professional forecasters. 
Analysts at Credit Suisse (LSE: 0QP5.L - news ) believe it will show another downward revision to inflation expectations, possibly foreshadowing a cut to the Eurosystem staff's next set of macroeconomic projections, which are due in December. 
Friday will also see the release of the latest batch of euro area manufacturing sector purchasing managers indices, for the month of October. Developments in Germany's factory sector will be scrutinised. 
In the UK, Tuesday will bring with it the latest data on public sector net borrowing, followed by the latest monthly retail sales numbers from ONS on Wednesday.
